document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Australian bee fly genus Meomyia Evenhuis, 1983, with description of three new species (Bombyliidae, Bombyliinae, Bombyliini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Australian bee fly genus Meomyia Evenhuis, 1983, with description of three new species (Bombyliidae, Bombyliinae, Bombyliini)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Australian National Insect Collection, CSIRO National Research Collections Australia, Canberra, ACT 2601, Australia. & Research School of Biology, Australian National University, Canberra, ACT 2601, Australia. http: // zoobank. org / urn: lsid: zoobank. org: author: 3 E 60358 E- 6540 - 480 B-A 330 - 980 A 0964 C 830

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Bombylius fasciculatus
Macquart, 1840: 93
[1841: 371]. Type-locality: “ Patrie inconnue” [= Australia (NSW)]; Holotype , NHMUK.

Bombylius platyurus Walker, 1849: 286
. Type-locality: Australia (WA); 3 Syntypes , NHMUK; 1 Syntype , OUMNH.

Bombylius crassus Walker, 1849: 287
. Type-locality: “ New Holland ” [= Australia ]; 1 Syntype , NHMUK.

Bombylius notatipennis
Macquart, 1855: 98
(78) [as “notati-pennis” on p. 149(129)]. Type-locality: Australia (NSW); Holotype , NHMUK.

Bombylius punctipennis
Thomson, 1869: 487
. Type-locality: Australia (NSW); Holotype , NHRS. [Preoccupied by Loew, 1855.].

Meomyia yeatesi Evenhuis & Greathead, 1999: 160
(new replacement name for
Bombylius punctipennis Thomson, 1869
).

Gunjin, 18 Oct 1981 , MJ Smart. ♀ S 32°00’ E 115°56’, Nr. Nannup, 24 Oct 1982 , MJ Smart. ♀ Smith’s Mill, HM Giles, 16 Oct 1909 .
Diagnosis. Body with yellowish and black hairs. Posterior margin of scutum with a black hair band. Wing membrane with clear spots.
Redescription. Male. Body length 8.6–11.2 mm , wing length 8.1–11.5 mm .

Thorax . Integumental colour of scutum mostly black with sparse grey pruinescence. Scutum covered with pale yellow hairs, hairs turning dark yellow apically and denser on anterior half, posterior margin with a black band, consisting of black hairs, postalar callus with four brownish yellow setae and admixed with black hairs. Five brownish yellow notopleural setae present. Scutellum black with sparse grey pruinescence, pruinescence denser on the margin, covered with pale yellow hairs, posterior margin with brownish yellow setae. Pleura black with thick pale pruinescence, mostly covered in long white hairs, except anterodorsal area of anepisternum with yellow setae, anepimeron, meron, laterotergite and mediotergite bare.

Legs . Legs mostly brownish yellow, except basal half of femora turning black; mostly covered in yellow scales, except anterior face of femora with black scales, ventral face of femora admixed with long brown and pale yellow hairs. Fore femur with one anterior bristle; mid femur with one row of anterior bristles; hind femur with one row of anteroventral bristles, and more separate bristles on apical half. Bristles and other hairs on legs brown. Fore tibia 2.1 x longer than fore basitarsus, mid tibia 2.6 x longer than mid basitarsus, hind tibia 2.2 x longer than hind basitarsus.

Wings . Wing membrane slightly infuscated, darker towards wing base, with some markings on base of
R 4
and
M 1
, apex of cell dm , base of crossvein m-cu , and apex of cell bm . Cell
r 5
closed; cell br shorter than cell bm , crossvein r-m arising from base of cell dm ; crossvein m-m as long as crossvein r-m ; cell cua open ( Fig. 7d ). Haltere stem brown, knob brownish yellow.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 6.
Meomyia fasciculata ( Macquart, 1840 )
. Holotype of
Bombylius fasciculatus Macquart, 1840
(NHMUK 010921898). (a) dorsal; (b) lateral. Scale bars = 1 mm.

FIGURE 7.
Meomyia fasciculata ( Macquart, 1840 )
. External (a–h (♂); i–n (♀)): (a, i) dorsal; (b, j) lateral; (c) antenna, lateral; (d) wing; (e, k) head, dorsal; (f, l) head, frontal; (g, m) head, profile; (h, n) head, lateral. Scale bars = 1 mm (a, b, d–n); = 0.1 mm (c).

FIGURE 8.
Meomyia fasciculata ( Macquart, 1840 )
. Genitalia (a–e (♂); f, g (♀)): (a) genital capsule, dorsal; (b) genital capsule, ventral; (c) genital capsule, lateral; (d) epandrium, dorsal; (e) epandrium, lateral; (f) sternite 8, ventral; (g) genitalia and spermathecae. Scale bars = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Abdomen . Integumental colour of tergites black mostly with thick grey pruinescence. Tergite 1 with dense pale yellow hairs; tergite 2 with pale yellow hairs on anterior half, and dense black hairs on posterior half; tergites 3–4 with dense pale yellow hairs; tergites 5–7 with dense black hairs, except median with sparse scales; tergite 8 with dense white hairs; posterior margin of tergites 1–7 with brownish yellow setae. Sternites black with thick pale pruinescence, sternites covered in dense white hairs, posterior margin with brownish yellow setae. Genitalia . Epandrium anterior margin strongly concave, posterior margin slightly concave ( Fig. 8d ). Lateral margin of gonocoxite nearly straight ( Figs 8 a–b); apex of epiphallus not modified, short ( Fig. 8c ).

Remarks. Roberts (1928: 415) considered
Bombylius crassus
,
Bombylius notatipennis
, and
Bombylius punctipennis
as synonyms of
Bombylius platyurus
(under the genus
Systoechus
). Later, Evenhuis & Greathead (1999) pointed out
Bombylius fasciculatus
is the most senior synonym of this species, however, they excluded
Bombylius punctipennis
(with replacement name of
Meomyia yeatesi
) without examining the type .

For
Meomyia yeatesi
, considering the distribution and easily recognised body features of this species, we follow the arrangement by Roberts (1928) , therefore it also treated as one of the junior synonyms of
Bombylius fasciculatus
here.
Distribution. Australia (NSW, Qld., SA, Tas., Vic., WA).
